trial_identification.studytitle: Intermittent Liposomal Amphotericin B Primary Prophylaxis
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomised, Stratified, Open Label, Phase II Pilot Study on the Safety of a Daily, Intermittent, or Weekly Administration of 1, 3 or 10mg/kg of AmBisome® in Antifungal Primary Prophylaxis of High-Risk Patients With Acute Myeloid Leukaemia

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Liposomal amphotericin B
Treatment: drugs: Liposomal amphotericin B

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety as defined by the incidence of all adverse events occurring by the completion of each trial prophylaxis course.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Incidence of proven or probable IFI
Incidence of fever of unknown origin requiring empirical antifungal therapy during any course of prophylaxis

recruitment.hospital: Box Hill Hospital, Eastern Health - Melbourne

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this trial is to see which dose of liposomal amphotericin B is the safest when used as a preventer against invasive fungal infection in patients with acute leukaemia who are undergoing chemotherapy.

contact.name: C. Orla Morrissey, MB, BCh, FRACP
contact.address: The Alfred Hospital, Level 2 Burnet Institute, Commercial Rd., Melbourne, 3004, Victoria, Australia

contact.name: C. Orla Morrissey, MB, BCh, FRACP
